block.p: Since its release six years ago, "Die Hard" has spawned a batch of blatant imitators. Among the essentials for a "Die Hard" clone: a tightly confined setting, a lone-gun-type hero and a game of cat-and-mouse. Not to mention considerable gunplay and pyrotechnics.

These movies also have another common thread: they have revived actors' stalled careers. Bruce Willis was considered a turn-off to audiences when "Die Hard" was released in 1988. Sylvester Stallone's career was on the ropes when he starred in "Cliffhanger." Steven Seagal didn't click with mainstream moviegoers until "Under Siege." And now Keanu Reeves's career may get a lift out of "Speed" (which opened on Friday) because the role finds him prancing about in a tight T-shirt showing off his new physique (a "Die Hard" essential).

Sylvester Stallone's career was on the ropes when he starred in "Cliffhanger." Steven Seagal didn't click with mainstream moviegoers until "Under Siege." And now Keanu Reeves's career may get a lift out of "Speed" (which opened on Friday) because the role finds him prancing about in a tight T-shirt showing off his new physique (a "Die Hard" essential).

As for other "Die Hard" knockoffs, they include the recent "Beverly Hills Cop III" ("Die Hard" in an amusement park), and several movies in the works: "Avalanche" ("Die Hard" in a cabin), "20 Minutes" ("Die Hard" in a Las Vegas casino), "Maelstrom" ("Die Hard" in a hurricane) and, of course, "Simon Says: Die Hard 3" and "Under Siege II: In Dark Territory." Herewith, a stroll through "Die Hard" country. Pat H. Broeske THE MOVIE "Die Hard" (1988) CONCEPT Blowing things up THE SETTING A Los Angeles high-rise, on Christmas Eve.
THE SITUATION The building has been commandeered by "terrorists" who are holding hostages on the 30th floor.

THE GOOD GUY An off-duty N.Y.C. cop, John McClane (Bruce Willis). HIS PERSONAL PREDICAMENT His estranged wife (Bonnie Bedelia) is among the hostages. THE QUIRKY VILLAIN Hans Gruber (Alan Rickman), a West German who reads Forbes, talks industrialization and men's fashions, and doesn't blink when he blows away a C.E.O.
WHAT HE WANTS Ostensibly, the release of political prisoners. In truth, $640 million in negotiable bonds in the building's computer-locked vault.
OR ELSE They start killing hostages.
THE TICKING CLOCK The Feds have two hours to meet their demands.
THE FIREPOWER FACTOR One-on-one battles to the death, a SWAT fire fight, detonations, a gunned-down helicopter, a 30-story plunge to death.

THE MOVIE "Die Hard 2: Die Harder" (1990) CONCEPT "Die Hard 2" THE SETTING Dulles International Airport, Washington, during Christmas week. THE SITUATION "Terrorists" take control of the airport. THE GOOD GUY John McClane (Bruce Willis) is back, this time as an off-duty L.A. cop. HIS PERSONAL PREDICAMENT His wife (Bonnie Bedelia) is on a plane that's running out of fuel and unable to land.
THE QUIRKY VILLAIN A Special Forces colonel (William Sadler), who exercises in the nude.
WHAT HE WANTS The release of a Noriega-type general and drug lord, a fully fueled 747 cargo plane so he can get to the tropics.
OR ELSE He won't restore the runway lighting, and planes will crash. THE TICKING CLOCK Only 90 minutes until the plane runs out of fuel.
THE FIREPOWER FACTOR Shoot-outs, bomb explosion, fiery passenger plane crash, fistfight atop plane during takeoff, ejection from exploding plane, chase on snowmobiles, death by icicle.
THE MOVIE "Under Siege" (1992) CONCEPT "Die Hard" on a battleship THE SETTING Aboard the U.S.S. Missouri. THE SITUATION It's a mutiny for money.

THE GOOD GUY The ship's cook, Casey Ryback (Steven Seagal). HIS PERSONAL PREDICAMENT He's really a highly decorated Navy Seal, serving time in the galley because of an attitude problem. THE QUIRKY VILLAIN Tommy Lee Jones (in studded black leather jacket and shades) as a former C.I.A. covert operative gone bad. (Also, Gary Busey as a psychotic Navy commander.) WHAT HE WANTS The ship's 32 Tomahawk missiles, 8 of which are nuclear tipped. OR ELSE They'll blow away anyone within 100 feet of the ship. THE TICKING CLOCK Two Tomahawks have been launched toward Honolulu. They will arrive in 24 minutes. THE FIREPOWER FACTOR Shoot-outs; a downed jet; exploding helicopters (one filled with Navy Seals); missile launches; a downed submarine; deaths by power saw, impalement, knives through the skull. THE MOVIE "Cliffhanger" (1993) CONCEPT "Die Hard" on a mountain THE SETTING The snowcapped Rockies. THE SITUATION A renegade Treasury Department agent and his cohorts are in search of bags containing $100 million.

THE GOOD GUY A Rocky Mountain Rescue Ranger, Gabriel Walker (Sylvester Stallone). HIS PERSONAL PREDICAMENT He's guilt-ridden over a clifftop death he couldn't prevent. THE QUIRKY VILLAIN A psychotic military intelligence operative, Eric Qualen (John Lithgow), who sports a bad English accent. WHAT HE WANTS The rangers to find those lost bags. OR ELSE Death. THE TICKING CLOCK The Feds are closing in, looking for the money.
THE FIREPOWER FACTOR Midair heist and shoot-out, plane crash landing, avalanche, explosions, helicopter crash, fight below the ice, impalement on a stalactite. THE MOVIE "Speed"

CONCEPT "Die Hard" on a bus THE SETTING An express elevator, a careering Los Angeles bus and a careering subway train. THE SITUATION A mad bomber is terrorizing Los Angeles. THE GOOD GUY An L.A.P.D. SWAT member Jack Traven (Keanu Reeves). HIS PERSONAL PREDICAMENT Given a hostage situation, he opts to shoot the hostage. THE QUIRKY VILLAIN A sociopath, Howard Payne (Dennis Hopper). WHAT HE WANTS $3.7 million in small, unmarked bills. OR ELSE A bomb on the bus will be detonated.
THE TICKING CLOCK If the bus's speed drops below 50 miles per hour, kapow!
THE FIREPOWER FACTOR Plunging express elevator, shoot-out in elevator tunnels, bus and plane explosions, trip on the Los Angeles freeways, beheading. FILM
